definition: to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: The third type does not have the sincerity of accepting criticism, only paying lip service.
sentences.chinese: 第三種人沒有采納批評的誠意，只是巧言令色。
她是個巧言令色的說謊高手。

sentences.english: He is man with artful speech and flashy manners.
A flattering friend is your worse enemy.
sentences.chinese: 巧言令色之友，是你最可怕的敵人。

definition: lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
